00084 #include <avr32/io.h>
00085 #if __GNUC__
00086 #  include "intc.h"
00087 #endif
00088 #include "board.h"
00089 #include "compiler.h"
00090 #include "rtc.h"
00091 #include "usart.h"
00092 #include "gpio.h"
00093 #include "pm.h"
00094 
00097 
00098 #if BOARD == EVK1100
00099 #  define EXAMPLE_USART               (&AVR32_USART1)
00100 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_RX_PIN        AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_PIN
00101 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_RX_FUNCTION   AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_FUNCTION
00102 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_TX_PIN        AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_PIN
00103 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_TX_FUNCTION   AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_FUNCTION
00104 #elif BOARD == EVK1101
00105 #  define EXAMPLE_USART               (&AVR32_USART1)
00106 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_RX_PIN        AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_0_PIN
00107 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_RX_FUNCTION   AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_0_FUNCTION
00108 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_TX_PIN        AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_0_PIN
00109 #  define EXAMPLE_USART_TX_FUNCTION   AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_0_FUNCTION
00110 #endif
00112 
00113 // To specify we have to print a new time
00114 volatile static int print_sec = 1;
00115 
00116 // Time counter
00117 static int sec = 0;
00118 
00119 #if __GNUC__
00120 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00121 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00122 /* RTC Interrupt  */
00123 #pragma handler = RTC_INT_GROUP, 1
00124 __interrupt
00125 #endif
00126 void rtc_irq(void)
00127 {
00128   // Increment the minutes counter
00129   sec++;
00130 
00131   // clear the interrupt flag
00132   rtc_clear_interrupt(&AVR32_RTC);
00133 
00134   // specify that an interrupt has been raised
00135   print_sec = 1;
00136 }
00137 
00141 char *print_i(char *str, int n)
00142 {
00143   int i = 10;
00144 
00145   str[i] = '\0';
00146   do
00147   {
00148     str[--i] = '0' + n%10;
00149     n /= 10;
00150   }while(n);
00151 
00152   return &str[i];
00153 }
00154 
00158 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00159 {
00160   char temp[20];
00161   char *ptemp;
00162   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00163 
00164   static const gpio_map_t USART_GPIO_MAP =
00165   {
00166     {EXAMPLE_USART_RX_PIN, EXAMPLE_USART_RX_FUNCTION},
00167     {EXAMPLE_USART_TX_PIN, EXAMPLE_USART_TX_FUNCTION}
00168   };
00169 
00170   // USART options
00171   static const usart_options_t USART_OPTIONS =
00172   {
00173     .baudrate     = 57600,
00174     .charlength   = 8,
00175     .paritytype   = USART_NO_PARITY,
00176     .stopbits     = USART_1_STOPBIT,
00177     .channelmode  = 0
00178   };
00179 
00180   // Assign GPIO pins to USART0.
00181   gpio_enable_module(USART_GPIO_MAP,
00182                      sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00183 
00184   // Initialize USART in RS232 mode at 12MHz.
00185   usart_init_rs232(EXAMPLE_USART, &USART_OPTIONS, 12000000);
00186 
00187   // Clear a VT100 terminal screen
00188   usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "\x1B[2J");
00189   // Welcome sentence
00190   usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "ATMEL\r\n");
00191   usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "AVR32 UC3 - RTC example\r\n");
00192 
00193   usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "RTC 32 KHz oscillator program test.\r\n");
00194 
00195   // Disable all interrupts. */
00196   Disable_global_interrupt();
00197 
00198   // The INTC driver has to be used only for GNU GCC for AVR32.
00199 #if __GNUC__
00200   // Initialize interrupt vectors.
00201   INTC_init_interrupts();
00202 
00203   // Register the RTC interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00204   INTC_register_interrupt(&rtc_irq, AVR32_RTC_RTC_IRQ, INT0);
00205 #endif
00206 
00207   // Initialize the RTC
00208   if (!rtc_init(&AVR32_RTC, RTC_OSC_32KHZ, RTC_PSEL_32KHZ_1HZ))
00209   {
00210     usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART0, "Error initializing the RTC\r\n");
00211     while(1);
00212   }
00213   // Set top value to 0 to generate an interruption every seconds */
00214   rtc_set_top_value(&AVR32_RTC, 0);
00215   // Enable the interruptions
00216   rtc_enable_interrupt(&AVR32_RTC);
00217   // Enable the RTC
00218   rtc_enable(&AVR32_RTC);
00219 
00220   // Enable global interrupts
00221   Enable_global_interrupt();
00222 
00223   while(1)
00224   {
00225     if (print_sec)
00226     {
00227       // Set cursor to the position (1; 5)
00228       usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "\x1B[5;1H");
00229       ptemp = print_i(temp, sec);
00230       usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "Timer: ");
00231       usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, ptemp);
00232       usart_write_line(EXAMPLE_USART, "s");
00233       print_sec = 0;
00234     }
00235   }
00236 }
